results.title: Beechworth
results.creator_credit: John Kingsford-Smith, Ampol Petroleum Ltd and National Trust
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Heritage”.
Historic buildings of the former gold mining town of Beechworth, Victoria, including the gold office, prison, powder magazine, churches and the Court House where Ned Kelly was tried three times.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Kingsford-Smith, Ampol Petroleum Ltd and National Trust

results.title: Becoming (2003)
results.brief_description: This work consists of 7 dual-channel installations. As viewers enter the exhibition space, they are faced by found footage of iconic performances delivered by seven popular Hollywood female leads and then paired with a version by Candice Breitz delivering the lines.

constellations_other.name: Sound and cinema
constellations_other.description: Beginning with one of the first films to be screened at the Palais (a Melbourne cinema with its own outstanding resident orchestra) the constellation celebrates sound as an integral part of the connection between moving image work and audience.

results.description:
Each actor’s lines of dialogue have been taken out of their narrative context, and the responses of the actors they play against have been eliminated. Each of these pieced-together performances is then paired with the Candice Breitz version of the same one-sided routine. Sharing the same soundtrack as the ‘original’, Breitz lipsyncs the same lines and uses the same gestures and expressions to produce a copy of the original.

This work consists of 7 dual-channel installations. As viewers enter the exhibition space, they are faced by found footage of iconic performances delivered by seven popular Hollywood female leads: Cameron Diaz, Julia Roberts, Jennifer Lopez, Meg Ryan, Neve Campbell, Reese Witherspoon and Drew Barrymore. On the reverse side of each of these screens, viewers will find an alternative performance delivered by the artist herself.
description_for_label:

As viewers enter the exhibition space, they are faced by found footage of iconic performances delivered by seven popular Hollywood female leads: Cameron Diaz, Julia Roberts, Jennifer Lopez, Meg Ryan, Neve Campbell, Reese Witherspoon and Drew Barrymore. results.title: Beating the drum
results.creator_credit: Fiona Cochrane, Louise Hubbard, F-Reel Pty Ltd and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: Melbourne has proven to be a mecca of sorts for musicians, with virtually any style of music being performed in clubs and halls across the city at any one time. ‘Beating the drum’ showcases some of these extraordinary performers who have migrated to Australia- some retain their traditional style, others have blended it in collaboration with other musicians. Both methods reflect the bigger issue of the cultural appropriation of music- whether there is such a thing, is there a right and wrong way to do it, how does Aboriginal music fit into this notion, and what we mean by world music? Musicians, academics, broadcasters and World Music aficionados take up this discussion through words and music. Musicians include: Xylouris Ensemble, Kavisha Mazzella and La Voce Della Luna, George Telek, Rembetika Compania, Terrasphere, Tom E. Lewis, Inka Marka, Taksim, Thula Sana, Adzohu, Fronteras, Vladimir Kocibelli, Petrunka, Tsicaderis Ensemble and Ta’Esh Fa’Esh.

results.title: Be well: physical fitness in the later years
results.brief_description: This film shows a variety of ways in which older people can stay physically active, or even start exercising regularly for the first time in their lives. Seniors who have incorporated such physical activities into their daily routines are living proof of the rewards.
